intro: Lastrea malaccensis, commonly known as the Malacca lastrea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
